intro: Wirtgenia schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in highland regions and is adapted to the local climate and soil conditions. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a robust root system. Wirtgenia schimperi is of interest for its potential ecological and medicinal uses.
